result.execSummary:
The defendant Quinn Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $400.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.  Court has no objection to sentence being served in another jurisdiction provided the Defendant can make the appropriate arrangements.  Balance of sentence to be served forthwith.

Case Called @ 1:35 PM: Defendant Quinn Johnson in court with attorney Jeffrey A Mann.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution recited by Atty Mann.  DOC will not be revoking Def.  Def and ADA confirm recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Meds serving no impairment on proceeding today.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Court accepts State's motion to amend as to Ct 1 to Misd level offense POT, Plea Ct 1 as amended:  NC   Plea Ct 3: NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct 2 DRI.  Statement offered by Def.  The Court:  Accepts resolution.  As to each count - 6 mos WCJ - concurrent to one another - GT and 64 days prior time served, Huber privileges - as PO hold is not a sentence - direct sentence today.  No objection to serving sentence in another jurisdiction if can be arranged by Def.  Unknown at this time what DOC will do with the PO hold - Defendant to be returned to Winnebago Co.

records.addlTxt: Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant is prohibited from going on the premises of any bars.  Not to be in the possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription as to the medication and proper quantity.

Case Called @ 2:05 PM: Defendant Quinn Johnson in court with attorney Bryan D. Keberlein.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per SPD:  Eligibility confirmed.  Def states PO hold remains even though bond of $400 was posted.  He has since lost his job due to hold. Court entertains waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing. Court accepts voluntary waiver of time limits.  Counsel will look to resolve both counties (Waushara/Winnebago).  Status conference scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on March 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Case Called @ 1:07 PM: Defendant Quinn Johnson in court, in custody, appearing via video.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Receipt of Complaint admitted and address confirmed.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Court finds probable cause exists to detain Defendant.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def is employed and will retain own counsel if necessary, currently he does not intend to have counsel, though he understands his right of counsel.  ADA argues as to bond - inherent flight risk due to charging.  Def makes statement as to bond request.  Explains ties to Oshkosh area with employment and wife.  Def does have the ability to post some cash witha  credit card.  Def does not believe he is a flight risk.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.   Def advised that he must appear for the IA scheduled.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
